ego < enkwo

𒀀𒈾𒆪 a-na-ku

𓁹 me=ego/eye/I
𓁹 -oj Albanian verb suffix

𓁹 maako
From Proto-Philippine *ʔakúʔ, from Proto-Malayo-Polynesian *(i-)aku, from Proto-Austronesian *(i-)aku.

𒌑𒊌 (ú-uk, “I” Ich, ego

waga 我が "my; our" and ware 我 "I; oneself; thou" are

𒌑𒆠𒂖 (ú-ke-el, “myself” 𓎛 𓄹 𓄹 𓄹 𓀀
𒌑𒆠𒆷 (ú-ki-la, “myself” 𓎛 𓄹 𓄹 𓄹 𓀀

The complicated form for "I" 𓏌𓎡𓍢 urkwoʳ is echoed in
Gothic 𐌿𐌲𐌺𐌰𐍂 ugkar and Hittite 𒌑𒊌 •wekhoʳ > ego Ick, Ich, wez (us,our)

In it's old reading 𓏌 nur > urn 𓏌 it reads as :
𓏌𓎡𓍢 urnkwo > anaku 𒀀𒈾𒆪 ante Ich אָנוֹכִי ʾānôḵî 我 ngo5 and Phoenician 𐤀𐤍𐤊 ʾnk 𐤀𐤍𐤊𐤉 ʾnky “I” 𓇋𓀀 𒁹𒆪 Ĩku

The r component becomes evident in the reading and meaning of 𒊌 as •URS (bear) => ours!

𓏌𓎡𓍢 corrupted form:
𒌑𒊑 uri my,me,mine ≠ Euer

𒂷𒂊 𒀀𒀀 𒍪 𒈨 𒂗
Ego VAva cu me han.
I am your father

ego vs siego > zu Euch 𒍣𒄿𒅅 zi-i-ik, “you”
1. ek 2. second person

ego ⇔ eyo eje ezome : https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Reconstruction:Proto-Indo-Aryan/a%C5%BA%CA%B0%C3%A1m

Hungarian ego:
ír (“to write”) →
írok (“I write, I am writing”)
írnék (“I would write”)
írjak (“I should write”)

https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Appendix:Hungarian_possessive_suffixes

wo we wir connected to ich ego via

𜏼𜑐𜑞𜏳 suhter "cabinet" save<ша́фа šáfa< שאַפֿע shafe שאַפֿקע shafke<szafa

Animate noun pronoun-suffixes in Elamite

-k ik ego I ⇔ 𓏌𓎡𓍢
-t tu you ⇔ 𓏏𓍢
-r er ⇔ 𓆑

König "I, king"
Könit "You, king"
Köner "He, king"
